III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications.
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation An unknown staff member is providing youth in pod 5 with vapes.
Vape emissions have been smelled, but none have been found in
recent checks.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via telephone 03/21/2025, no
additional information was provided.
Administrator 1 was interviewed at the facility on 03/21/2025 and
on 03/26/2025, in collaboration with DHHS Specialist.
Administrator 1 reported he is only aware of one incident on pod 5
involving Youth A having two vape pens. He said on 03/07/2025
Youth A was in the calming room and when he was escorted back
to the pod the metal detector went off and that’s when the vape
pens were found with Youth A. Administrator 1 reported Youth A
initially refused to say where he got the vape pens, but after
speaking with Therapist, Youth A said Staff 1 gave him the vape
pen. When questioned further, Youth A then told Therapist that
Administrator 1 gave him the vape pens. Therapist asked Youth A
to write a statement, however Youth A refused to write a
statement about where he obtained the vape pens. Administrator
1 adamantly denied he or Staff 1 gave Youth A the vape pens.
Administrator 2 was interviewed at the facility on 03/26/2025 in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Administrator 2 reported he
was notified of an incident involving Youth A having two vape
pens. He said Youth A was returning to the pod after being in the
calming room when the vape pens were found on him. Youth A
gave conflicting stories about where he got the vape pen and
refused to provide a written statement. Administrator 2 said that is
the reason it could not be determined where Youth A obtained the
vape pens. Administrator 2 spoke with Staff 1 and Administrator 1
and they both denied providing Youth A with the vape pens.
Administrator 2 said Youth A did go on a home pass on
03/01/2025, however when youths return from a home pass they
go through the metal detector. Administrator 2 reported that staff
are required to complete random room searches as well.
2

Youth A was interviewed at the facility on 03/21/2025 and on
03/26/2025, in collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Youth A has
been at the facility for seven months and is placed on Pod 5.
Youth A admitted he had two vape pens that he found in the gym
bathroom. He said he had the vape pens for a few days before he
went to the calming room. Youth A adamantly denied Staff 1, or
any other staff gave him the vape pens. He further denied ever
seeing any staff member using or having vape pens on the pod.
Youth A reported he goes every weekend on home passes and
when he returns from a home pass, he goes through the metal
detector and is searched.
Youth B was interviewed at the facility on 03/26/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Youth B has been at the
facility for six months and is placed on pod 5. Youth B recalled
hearing that Youth A had two vapes pens and that he found them
in the gym. Youth B denied witnessing any staff member using or
giving vape pens to Youth A. Youth B reported that staff conduct
random room searches and does not recall any vape pens found
with any other youths. Youth B reported feeling safe and all his
needs are being met.
Youth C was interviewed at the facility on 03/26/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Youth C has been at the
facility for five months and is placed on pod 5. Youth C recalled
that Youth A had the vape pens for several days before staff found
them. He said Youth A told him he found the vape pens in the
gym. Youth C denied witnessing staff give Youth A the vape pens,
and further denied ever witnessing any staff member using or
having vape pens on the pod.
Youth D and Youth E were interviewed at the facility on
03/26/2025, in collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Youth D and
Youth E are placed on pod 5. Youth D and Youth E denied
witnessing staff have vape pens or provide Youth A with the vape
pens. Youth D and Youth E reported all their needs are being met
and expressed no concerns regard staff or the facility.
Staff 1 was interviewed at the facility on 03/26/2025 in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Staff 1 has been working at
the facility for two months. Staff 1 recalled the incident involving
Youth A having been found with two vape pens. She was
assigned to Pod 5 on 03/07/2025, Youth A was upset and wanted
to go to the calming room. She took Youth A to the calming room,
after a few minutes in the calming room Administrator 1 came in
and told her to take Youth A back to the pod. Youth A went
3

through the metal detector, the metal detector went off, and that’s
when it was discovered that Youth A had the vape pens in his
pocket. She said initially Youth A accused her of giving him the
vape pens and then later said he got them when he went on his
home pass. Staff 1 denied vaping or giving Youth A the vape
pens. Staff 1 further denied witnessing any other staff member
using or giving youths a vape pen.
Staff 2 was interviewed at the facility on 03/26/2025 in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Staff 2 has been working at
the facility for two years. Staff 2 recalled on 03/07/2025 witnessing
Youth A walking through the metal detector and the metal detector
going off. She said Youth A did not disclose where he got the
vape pens. She denied witnessing any staff member with vape
pens or giving Youth A the vape pens. She said staff must lock all
personal items in the locker and cannot take anything on the pod.
JJ Worker was interviewed via telephone on 03/28/2025. JJ
Worker reported Youth A has been at the facility for 7 months.
She said Youth A does have history of using vapes when he was
in the community. JJ Worker was notified of the incident and was
informed that Youth A kept changing his story of where he got the
vapes. She expressed no concerns regarding the facility or staff.
Therapist was interviewed via telephone on 04/15/2025.
Therapist is the assigned therapist to Youth A. Therapist has been
working with Youth A for 7 months, meets with him weekly for one
hour therapy sessions, and has good rapport with Youth A. She
reported on 03/07/2025 she met with Youth A after he was found
with two vapes. Initially Youth A was adamant he was not going to
tell her where he got the vape pens from. After a few minutes he
said he found them in the gym, then he said Staff 1 gave him the
vape pens. When question about when Staff 1 gave him the pens,
he said Administrator 1 gave him the vape pens. She said Youth A
kept changing his story, so she asked him to write a statement,
but he refused to write a statement. Therapist said Youth A does
go on home passes and had been on a home pass on
03/01/2025. She said youths are required to go through the metal
detector after a home pass.
Documents Reviewed:
• Unusual Incident report summary dated 03/07/2025 written
by Administrator 1. Report is consistent with Administrator
1’s interview.
4

• Notification of a Youth Reintegration visit for Youth A dated
03/01/2025- Youth A left at 8:00am and returned to the
facility at 7:00pm.
• Facility resident search policy: Safety and Security
Coordinator must search residents at intake and when
returning from a community event.
• Facility Handbook details that contraband are prohibited.
Any unauthorized items in a youth’s your possession or in
their room will be considered contraband. Contraband
includes any item out of its designated area or any item that
is prohibited to you by program rules or treatment staff.
• Staff 1 does not have a disciplinary record. Staff 1
completed all new employee training on 02/20/2025.
Analysis The facility is compliant with the rule based on interviews
conducted and documentation reviewed there is insufficient
evidence that staff provided youth with a vape pen.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
Technical assistance was offered to the facility to update the
Notification of a Youth Reintegration visit form to include youth
was searched when returning from a home visit.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
